title: The Agent Use Cases Most Ready for Primetime

rawLines.text: hello friends spring break week
continues with another interview episode
and this time I am once again joined by
Newfar Gaspar to discuss the agent use
cases that we're seeing come up most
often Newfar is once again a brilliant
AI analyst product and strategy leader
who has consulted with some of the
biggest companies in the world on AI
strategy and who works with us at super
intelligent on our agent readiness
audits and our agent marketplace Today
we're looking at some of the agent use
cases that are most in demand coming out
of both our audits and our agent
marketplace as a way to potentially help
you understand what agent uses are
actually ready for prime time and which
still remain a little bit farther
away All right Newfar welcome back to
the show This is not exactly a part two
from from what we did before but uh I
think a lot of people will will connect
the dots Before we talking about what
mistakes are common that we're commonly
seeing among organizations as relates to
AI broadly but agents specifically Today
we're talking about what agent use cases
are are actually ready for prime time
what agent use cases are being
implemented right now and people are
finding success with And again this
comes back and hearkens to sort of a
theme from from that previous show as
well which is you know how can we help
organizations spend their time more
effectively in this in this agent and AI

going to talk about some use cases uh
specifically obviously but I think that
where we wanted to start is talking
about just based on our our set of

huge number of conversations with
different types of companies both in the

with with these agent readiness audits
but also in terms of your independent

being overly reductive Where are orgs

infranchised organizations that that
we're tending to deal with Yeah So I
assume let's assume that there is some
bias because if they're very very mature

everything that we've seen thus far are

agent initiation or agent exploration

they've started working on a on a
handful of agents or some agents ideas
but in general they're very early stages
and like we talked about the seven
common mistakes in many cases there are
so not ready that they have a lot of
work to do in preparation for agents
even before they can introduce the for
the first one So they're very very early
on We are seeing uh some organizations
and we actually encourage them in some
cases that almost have no AI adoption
but are looking into agents as the way
for them to bridge the gap of how much

smaller organizations where it makes
more sense for them to hire an agent

Do you want to talk about also the

so we're I I think maybe maybe a better

offtheshelf kind of agents that they

customer support is by far the most

I think that that bridges us into maybe

of the second thing that we wanted to

agents are ready for prime time There
are some pretty distinct patterns in
what we're not seeing I was on a

these are the most advanced portions of

They're the internal champions and it's

sophistication duration cap capability
to be used for those specific
purpose-built use cases that are the

In some cases they don't want to tackle
